text.0: let the prayer issue from the seat of order for sūrya with his beams hath loosed the cattle.
text.1: with lofty ridges earth is far extended and agnis flame hath lit the spacious surface.
text.2: o asuras o varuṇa and mitra this hymn to you like food anew i offer.
text.3: one of you is a strong unerring leader and mitra speaking stirreth men to labour.
text.4: the movements of the gliding wind come hither like cows the springs are filled to overflowing.
text.5: born in the station een of lofty heaven the bull hath loudly bellowed in this region.
text.6: may i bring hither with my song o indra wise aryaman who yokes thy dear bay horses.
text.7: voracious with thy noble car o hero him who defeats the wrath of the malicious.
text.8: in their own place of sacrifice adorers worship to gain long life and win his friendship.
text.9: he hath poured food on men when they have praised him be this the dearest reverence paid to rudra.
text.10: coming together glorious loudly roaring  sarasvatī mother of floods the seventh.
text.11: with copious milk with fair streams strongly flowing full swelling with the volume of their water.
text.12: and may the mighty maruts too rejoicing aid our devotion and protect our offspring.
text.13: let not swiftmoving aksara neglect us they have increased our own appropriate riches.
text.14: bring ye the great aramati before you and pūṣan as the hero of the synod.
text.15: bhaga who looks upon this hymn with favour and as our strength the bountiful purandbi.
text.16: may this our song of praise reach you o maruts and viṣṇu guardian of the future infant.
text.17: may they vouchsafe the singer strength for offspring preserve us evermore ye gods with blessings.
